hints.content: To divide a shape in fourths, we divide the whole into **$4$ equal parts**.

This square is divided into $4$ pieces, but the pieces are not  equal in size:  

![A square has 3 parallel diagonal lines dividing it into 4 unequal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/3734852ede35af22eb1b14f8272c0a440999ba62)

These squares are divided into fourths:  

![A square has 1 vertical line and 1 horizontal line dividing it into 4 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/e2a79d9724bad9ec6961c96baaf37253271f042f)

![A square has 2 diagonal lines from opposite corners dividing it into 4 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/ef7f7f5f177549b2eb025edd1eb633e95bc075e8)

![A square has 3 horizontal lines dividing it into 4 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4a7218389d7c42696a5b6610da2d1497c136575f)

question.content:
**Which squares are divided into fourths?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

choices.content: ![A square has 1 vertical line and 1 horizontal line dividing it into 4 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/e2a79d9724bad9ec6961c96baaf37253271f042f)
![A square has 2 diagonal lines from opposite corners dividing it into 4 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/ef7f7f5f177549b2eb025edd1eb633e95bc075e8)
![A square has 3 horizontal lines dividing it into 4 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4a7218389d7c42696a5b6610da2d1497c136575f)
![A square has 3 parallel diagonal lines dividing it into 4 unequal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/3734852ede35af22eb1b14f8272c0a440999ba62)
